reviews.title: flex items-center relative flex-shrink-0
reviews.pros: It was very easy implementation and linking the data to GCP. It was used as the dashboard tool both for internal(marketing and business) and external(clients) teams. UI was user friendly and easy to set up.

reviews.title: flex items-center gap-1 mb-4
reviews.pros: Looker is a rich and easy to use platform. It supports a lot of great connections and building visualizations or modifying them is intuitive.

reviews.title: flex items-center gap-1 mb-4
reviews.pros: Versatility to self program and apply analytics with various data warehouse structures. Also bug fixing and changes in data structures can easily be understood by teams without customer support involvement.

reviews.title: flex items-center gap-1 mb-4
reviews.pros: The reports are very customable, you can design a report almost as if you were working in power point. Like a drag-and-drop of different type of charts, and everything is connected to the sources you integrate.

reviews.title: mb-4
reviews.pros: It was very easy implementation and linking the data to GCP. It was used as the dashboard tool both for internal(marketing and business) and external(clients) teams. UI was user friendly and easy to set up.
reviews.cons: There were a few bugs and issues with the dashboard. Some was that there were discrepancies between the main database and GCP, which resulted in missing data in the final dashboard.

reviews.title: review-content-Capterra___6868759
reviews.pros: Looker is a rich and easy to use platform. It supports a lot of great connections and building visualizations or modifying them is intuitive.
reviews.cons: Google Organizations and Google Groups on occasion can be confusing as you manage the organization of or cleanse access to Looker dashboards.

reviews.title: mb-4
reviews.pros: Versatility to self program and apply analytics with various data warehouse structures. Also bug fixing and changes in data structures can easily be understood by teams without customer support involvement.
reviews.cons: Some visual representations are falling behind the competitors. This especially plays a role when making the visuals fit / scrolling for various screens.

reviews.title: mb-4
reviews.pros: The reports are very customable, you can design a report almost as if you were working in power point. Like a drag-and-drop of different type of charts, and everything is connected to the sources you integrate.
reviews.cons:
It takes time to understand the tool, the resources integration can be confusing when you start using it. Also many useful charts are not available unless you install extensions. Would be also good if you could connect more resources than just Google ones, for example Facebook or linked in, without having to pay a third party for this solution.

Switched from
Semrush
Whatagraph

We needed something more accurate and more customizable. Also a cheaper solution with more options.

reviews.title: mb-4
reviews.review_text: >Looker's flexibility is awesome, especially with its LookML modeling. It means we define our business logic once, and it's consistent everywhere. This makes it super easy for anyone to dig into the data without needing to know complex code. Plus, quickly creating new reports and drilling down is a breeze. Version control for LookML is also a huge win for teamwork!
reviews.pros: Looker's flexibility is awesome, especially with its LookML modeling. It means we define our business logic once, and it's
reviews.cons: istent everywhere. This makes it super easy for anyone to dig into the data without needing to know complex code. Plus, quickly creating new reports and drilling down is a breeze. Version control for LookML is also a huge win for teamwork!

reviews.title: flex items-center gap-2 mb-2
reviews.pros: It is a great tool to visualize data, from results to objetives, evolutions, etc
reviews.cons: My main gripe is with the visualizations. Looker's great for data, but I really wish it had more advanced and complex chart types built-in. Sometimes, for really specific visuals, I have to export data or use other tools, which isn't ideal. While you can build custom visuals, it's not as straightforward as I'd like, and the standard options feel a bit basic for telling richer data stories.

reviews.title: flex items-center gap-1 mb-4
reviews.pros: Good free tool from Google for data visualisation and dashboard building

reviews.title: flex items-center gap-1 mb-4
reviews.pros: Looker is an excellent data modeling software with strong version control features

reviews.title: mb-4
reviews.pros: Looker's flexibility is awesome, especially with its LookML modeling. It means we define our business logic once, and it's
reviews.cons:
istent everywhere. This makes it super easy for anyone to dig into the data without needing to know complex code. Plus, quickly creating new reports and drilling down is a breeze. Version control for LookML is also a huge win for teamwork!

Cons

My main gripe is with the visualizations. Looker's great for data, but I really wish it had more advanced and complex chart types built-in. Sometimes, for really specific visuals, I have to export data or use other tools, which isn't ideal. While you can build custom visuals, it's not as straightforward as I'd like, and the standard options feel a bit basic for telling richer data stories.

reviews.cons: It is sometimes a little bit slow to charge the dashboards
